snippet: At a federal civil trial in Brooklyn, a former official of the institution, Shukry Bishara, said it forwarded money to families affected by the Palestinian uprising.
abstract: Shukry Bishara, Palestinian finance minister and former executive at Arab Bank, testifies that bank forwarded money to families affected by Palestinian uprising; 300 plaintiffs are accusing Arab Bank of knowingly handling transactions for terrorists, in the first civil trial of a bank under the Anti-Terrorism Act.
lead_paragraph: At a federal civil trial in Brooklyn, a former official of the institution, Shukry Bishara, said it forwarded money to families affected by the Palestinian uprising.

headline.main: Witness for Arab Bank Says Disputed Payments Were Humanitarian
